content.description: Start with your left hand on a small crimp rail to the left of the arete and your right hand on a sidepull on the right side. Slap up the arete with your left hand and use ok slopers for your right hand. Finish right of the arete.
content.location: This ascends the obvious arete on the left side of the Beachside Boulder.

content.description: Slab Castle ascends an easy slab with relatively small but readily available crimps. It is also the downclimb for Triangle And Error and Phat Crack.
content.location: This is to the left of Triangle And Error, the obvious slab.

content.description: Follow a very thin fingertips crack up the steep face to the right of Triangle and Error. Predominantly use the finger crack, but occasionally throw to sloper sidepulls with the right hand. The crux is in the bottom section. It has a moderate mantel topout with good holds to pull over the lip.
content.location: This is to the right of Triangle and Error. It is on the shortest, most steep face on the Beachside Boulder.

content.description: This is a quality granite block about 12-13 feet tall composed of very solid rock with good crimps and crack systems. Quality problems range from easy slabs to technical aretes and tough, overhanging finger cracks.
